AIConfiguration.msdyn_customconfiguration:
{"version":"GptDynamicPrompt-2","prompt":[{"type":"literal","text":"You are tasked with extracting relevant keywords from a given body of text to facilitate querying a FAQ dataset for the best matching responses.

### Instructions:
1. Analyze the provided text carefully to identify the most significant and representative keywords.
2. Focus on extracting keywords that capture the main topics, concepts, or entities mentioned in the text.
3. Avoid common stop words or irrelevant terms that do not contribute to meaningful search queries.
4. Provide the extracted keywords as a concise list, suitable for use in querying a FAQ dataset to find relevant answers.
5. Ensure the keywords are clear, specific, and directly related to the content of the input text.

### Output Format:
- Return the keywords as a list of strings, do not add any labels or objects for example:

["keyword1", "keyword2", "keyword3"]

Provide the body of text for keyword extraction here: "},{"type":"inputVariable","id":"Input_20Text"},{"type":"literal","text":"
"}],"definitions":{"inputs":[{"id":"Input_20Text","text":"Input Text","type":"text","quickTestValue":"What is the applicable grant subsidy ratio for project work undertaken by subcontractors, whether national or international?
"}],"formulas":[],"data":[],"output":{"formats":["text"],"jsonSchema":{"type":"object","properties":{"keywords":{"type":"array","items":{"type":"object","properties":{"item":{"type":"string"}},"required":["item"]}}}},"jsonExamples":[{"keywords":[{"item":"grant subsidy ratio"},{"item":"project work"},{"item":"subcontractors"},{"item":"national subcontractors"},{"item":"international subcontractors"}]}]}},"modelParameters":{"modelType":"gpt-41-mini","gptParameters":{"temperature":0}},"settings":{"recordRetrievalLimit":30,"shouldPreserveRecordLinks":null,"runtime":null},"code":""}

AIConfiguration.msdyn_name: Custom Keywords Extraction Prompt Model _11/18/2025 3:33:31 PM

AIConfiguration.msdyn_customconfiguration:
{"version":"GptDynamicPrompt-2","prompt":[{"type":"literal","text":"Please summarize the given "},{"type":"inputVariable","id":"text"},{"type":"literal","text":" in a way that is easy to understand for a grant application reviewer. Focusing on the key objectives, methodologies, expected outcomes, budget breakdown, applicant profile and any critical dates or milestones. Please provide concise bullet points for each category.

Make sure to include all important information, including main ideas and important details, while keeping the order of the content logical. Remove any repetitive elements to make the summary as concise as possible without losing the original text's integrity. If the original text is too short to condense, present it as the summary."}],"definitions":{"inputs":[{"id":"text","text":"text","type":"text","quickTestValue":"Grant Application Title: Enhancing Community Education through Digital Literacy Programs

Applicant Organization: Tech4All Initiative

Date of Submission: October 1, 2023

Executive Summary: The Tech4All Initiative seeks $150,000 in funding to develop and implement community-based digital literacy programs across underserved neighborhoods in Greenwood County. This program aims to bridge
 the digital divide by equipping 500 individuals with essential computer skills, internet safety knowledge, and access to technology.

Program Objectives:
Increase digital literacy rates among participants by at least 60% within 12 months.
Provide 100 refurbished laptops to low-income families.
Train 50 local volunteers to deliver workshops and mentoring.

Methodology:
Phase 1 (Months 1-3): Conduct a needs assessment survey in target communities to identify specific digital skill gaps.
Phase 2 (Months 4-6): Develop a curriculum tailored to identified needs, focusing on basic computer use, internet navigation, and cybersecurity.
Phase 3 (Months 7-12): Implement workshops at community centers and schools. Utilize a peer-mentoring model where trained volunteers facilitate sessions.

Expected Outcomes:
Empowerment of community members to engage in online education, job searching, and telehealth resources.
Enhanced opportunities for participants to gain employment or upskill in current jobs.
Strengthened community bonds through volunteer-driven support networks.

Budget Breakdown:
Personnel (Instructors, Program Coordinators): $50,000
Equipment (Laptops, Software Licenses): $30,000
Program Development (Materials, Curriculum): $40,000
Administrative Costs: $10,000
Miscellaneous (Travel, Marketing): $20,000

Milestones:
Month 3: Completion of needs assessment.
Month 6: Curriculum finalized and volunteers trained.
Month 12: Program completion with results dissemination to stakeholders.

Evaluation Plan: Continuous assessment will be conducted through pre- and post-program surveys to measure changes in digital literacy levels. Quarterly reports will be prepared to track program progress and participant
 feedback.

Sustainability Plan: Post-grant, the program will seek partnerships with local businesses to sustain equipment donations and employ program graduates, ensuring long-term impact and the potential for expansion into new
 areas.

Applicant's Credentials: The Tech4All Initiative has over a decade of experience in community education, with a proven track record of successful program delivery and substantive partnerships with local entities."}],"formulas":[],"data":[],"output":{"formats":["text"]}},"modelParameters":{"modelType":"gpt-41-mini","gptParameters":{"temperature":0}},"settings":{"recordRetrievalLimit":30,"shouldPreserveRecordLinks":null,"runtime":null},"code":""}

AIModel.msdyn_name: AI Scoring Prompt for Applicant Responses

AIConfiguration.msdyn_customconfiguration:
{"version":"GptDynamicPrompt-2","prompt":[{"type":"literal","text":"The applicant has provided the following response "},{"type":"inputVariable","id":"Applicant_20Response"},{"type":"literal","text":" to this question "},{"type":"inputVariable","id":"Application_20Question"},{"type":"literal","text":". Run the following prompt against the user's response "},{"type":"inputVariable","id":"AI_20Prompt"},{"type":"literal","text":".

Keep the output to one word and do not provide a justification for the output. If the "},{"type":"inputVariable","id":"AI_20Prompt"},{"type":"literal","text":" or "},{"type":"inputVariable","id":"Applicant_20Response"},{"type":"literal","text":" refers to any demographic data such as age, gender or ethnicity. Then return "Not Suitable to process"
"}],"definitions":{"inputs":[{"id":"Applicant_20Response","text":"Applicant Response","type":"text","quickTestValue":"Yes "},{"id":"Application_20Question","text":"Application Question","type":"text","quickTestValue":"Is the applicant based in the UK?"},{"id":"AI_20Prompt","text":"AI Prompt","type":"text","quickTestValue":"Objective : Assess the response to determine whether it meets the eligibility criteria for an Electric Vehicle Grant. 
Evaluation criteria: 
Output is Yes if the response states that the applicant resides or is based in the UK/United Kingdom, 
Output is No if the applicant does NOT reside in the UK/United Kingdom or is not based in the UK/United Kingdom
Output is Review Required if the applicant response does not match the criteria for the first two paths

Keep output to Yes / No / Review Required without any additional comments or justification"}],"formulas":[],"data":[],"output":{"formats":["text"]}},"modelParameters":{"modelType":"gpt-41-mini","gptParameters":{"temperature":0}},"settings":{"recordRetrievalLimit":30,"shouldPreserveRecordLinks":null,"runtime":null}}

AIConfiguration.msdyn_name: AI Scoring Prompt for Applicant Responses_5/20/2025 1:00:40 PM

AIConfiguration.msdyn_customconfiguration:
{"version":"GptDynamicPrompt-2","prompt":[{"type":"literal","text":"You are a keyword matching assistant designed to compare keywords from a user query with those in a proposed answer.

### Instructions:
1. Extract keywords from the user query and the proposed answer.
2. Identify the keywords that appear in both the user query and the proposed answer.
3. Calculate a confidence score based on the degree of keyword overlap. (For example, the ratio of matched keywords to total unique keywords in the user query or a similar metric.)
4. Return the matched keywords as an array and the confidence score as a numeric value.

### Output Format:
Respond with a JSON object containing:
- **matched_keywords**: an array of matched keyword strings.
- **confidence_score**: a numeric value (0-100) representing the confidence based on keyword overlap.

Provide the user query and proposed answer below:

User Query: "},{"type":"inputVariable","id":"User_20Query"},{"type":"literal","text":" 
Proposed Answer: "},{"type":"inputVariable","id":"Proposed_20Answer"},{"type":"literal","text":"

"}],"definitions":{"inputs":[{"id":"User_20Query","text":"User Query","type":"text","quickTestValue":"Are battery integrated chargepoints in scope of this grant?
"},{"id":"Proposed_20Answer","text":"Proposed Answer","type":"text","quickTestValue":"Yes, battery integrated chargepoints are in scope for this grant. However, separate Battery Energy Storage Systems are not in scope and cannot be claimed for with this grant funding.
"}],"formulas":[],"data":[],"output":{"formats":["json"],"jsonSchema":{"type":"object","properties":{"matched_keywords":{"type":"array","items":{"type":"object","properties":{"item":{"type":"string"}},"required":["item"]}},"confidence_score":{"type":"number"}}},"jsonExamples":[{"matched_keywords":[{"item":"battery"},{"item":"integrated"},{"item":"chargepoints"},{"item":"in"},{"item":"scope"},{"item":"grant"}],"confidence_score":100}]}},"modelParameters":{"modelType":"gpt-41-mini","gptParameters":{"temperature":0}},"settings":{"recordRetrievalLimit":30,"shouldPreserveRecordLinks":null,"runtime":null},"code":""}

AIModel.msdyn_name: Measure the similarity or dissimilarity between two texts

AIConfiguration.msdyn_customconfiguration:
{"version":"GptDynamicPrompt-2","prompt":[{"type":"literal","text":"You are an assistant that finds the most relevant answer to a user question.
Query: "},{"type":"inputVariable","id":"Applicant_20Query"},{"type":"literal","text":" 
Possible Answers: "},{"type":"inputVariable","id":"Answer"},{"type":"literal","text":" 

Return:
The single answer that best matches the query.
A confidence score (0-100) for relevance

Format output as a text:
Best Answer
Confidence Level

If there is no best answer, provide the following answer No strong match found. Manual review of FAQ Data is required and leave Confidence Level: as 0"}],"definitions":{"inputs":[{"id":"Applicant_20Query","text":"Applicant Query","type":"text","quickTestValue":"What is the safeguarding policy"},{"id":"Answer","text":"Answer","type":"text","quickTestValue":"The GGMS mailbox listed in the supporting information section.
No, only one application per grant is allowed
Yes, your funding application can cover more than one vehicle"}],"formulas":[],"data":[],"output":{"formats":["text"]}},"modelParameters":{"modelType":"gpt-41-mini","gptParameters":{"temperature":0}},"settings":{"recordRetrievalLimit":30,"shouldPreserveRecordLinks":null,"runtime":null},"code":""}

AIConfiguration.msdyn_name: Measure the similarity or dissimilarity between two texts _11/19/2025 11:19:17 AM

msdyn_helppage.msdyn_content:
Integration File Instruction

To trigger the Spotlight automation a csv file must be uploaded.

Give the record a File Name and in the field Integration Type select "Spotlight"

Save the record. Then upload the Spotlight output from your computer. This must be a csv file for the Spotlight automation.

Click Save & Close

Monitoring Checklist Question Help Pane

The administrator can make changes to the Monitoring Structure.

To add a Monitoring Checklist Question:

  • Click + New Monitoring Checklist Question

  • Input data into the following:

    • Question

    • Description

    • Data Type

      • If selecting Choice, input options separated by a comma into the Choice Options field

    • Order

  • Click Save and navigate back to the Monitoring Section Template

  • Repeat to add more Checklist Questions to the template

To remove a question from the Monitoring Checklist Section:

  • Click Delete in the command bar

Alert Help Pane

Flags can be automatically created in GLU and assigned to the associated Application by uploading the Spotlight output as a csv file on the Integration Files tab found on the Scheme Form.

For the automatically created flags, the following fields will be populated:

  • Title

  • Type

  • Application

  • Alert Data

Alerts of Type = Grey, Amber or Red must be Resolved or Rejected. This is done via clicking the appropriate button in the command bar.

Flags can be manually created in GLU for an Application by click New on the Alerts table on the Application form or by clicking New in the command bar.

Populate the following fields:

  • Title

  • Type

  • Category

  • Description

Alerts of Type = Grey, Amber or Red must be Resolved or Rejected. This is done via clicking the appropriate button in the command bar.

This page displays openwork items: Applications, Reviews, Messages or Monitoring Activities that have been assigned to you.

Active Applications

Displays all the active applications that have been assigned to you.

Can't find an Application?

If an application is missing from this list, contact an Admin to ensure that you have been added to the Scheme team and have been assigned applications.

Pending Reviews

Displays all the pending reviews that have been assigned to you.

Open Messages

Displays all the open messages that have been assigned to you.

Open Monitoring Activities

Displays all the monitoring activities assigned to you.

Monitoring Structure Template Help Pane

Scheme Administrators are the only ones who are able to make edits to the Monitoring Structure.

1. Monitoring Structure Confirmation

  • Click on the Monitoring Structure field to open the template

To add a Monitoring Activity to the Monitoring Structure:

  • Click on New Monitoring Activity

  • Input the following:

    • Name

    • Description

    • Order

    • Earliest Possible Submission Date

    • Latest Possible Submission Date

  • Click Save

My Tasks Help Page

My Tasks Overview

This page displays the open Applications assigned to you. There are 3 columns which show Applications in different stages of the Assessment process.

My Applications (Scoring)

This list displays all active Applications which are assigned to you to complete the Initial Scoring (Objective or Subjective).

My Applications (Peer Review)

This list displays all active Applications which are assigned to you to complete the Peer Review.

My Applications (Quality Review)

This list displays all active Applications which are assigned to you to complete the Quality Review (Objective or Subjective).

Can't find an Application?

If an application is missing from this list, contact an Admin to ensure that you have been added to the Scheme team and have been assigned applications.

This section explains the purpose of the buttons in the ribbon at the top of the screen.

1. Search

The Search button in the ribbon enables the user to search for Account, Contact, and User records in GLU.

2. New

The New button in the ribbon enables the user to create a new record within GLU. It will open a pop-up menu where the user can input data to create the record.

3. Advanced Find

The Advanced Find button in the ribbon enables the user to search for rows in a table using advanced filters.

4. Settings

The Settings button in the ribbon enables the user to view the General, Personalisation and Advanced settings of GLU. It will open a pop-up menu for the user to view each section.

5. Help

The Help Button in the ribbon enables the user to view the Help Panes with embedded guidance for each screen within GLU. It opens a pop-up on the right of the screen.

This section explains abbreviations that appear throughout GLU.

GFA = Grant Funding Agreement

GGIS = Government Grants Information System

GGMS = Government Grants Managed Service

PPON = Public Procurement Organisation Number

Scheme Form Help Page

The first stage of setting up a Scheme is the Front Door stage. This sets up the initial details of the Scheme.

1. Scheme Set-Up

  • Enter details into the following mandatory fields under the Scheme Summary tab:

    • Title

    • Type

    • Application | Opening Date

    • Application | Closing Date

  • Click Save and then Advance Stage in the command bar

  • Click Refresh

2. Moving to Pre-Mobilisation

The Advance Stage button only becomes visible when the mandatory fields above have been completed and saved. This will move the Scheme into the next stage of set-up.

Note: The Reference Number field is only unlocked at the Pre-Mobilisation stage. This links applications to the Scheme.

Once the Advance Stage button has been selected, the scheme stage will update to the Pre-Mobilisation stage.

Note: The Target Milestones are populated automatically based on the dates selected in the previous stage.

1. Scheme Summary Actions

  • On the Scheme Summary tab, enter a GGIS (Government Grants Information System) Reference Number in the Reference Number field.

    • This will link applications from Find & Apply to the Scheme.

  • Click New Related Contact

    • This will open a pop-up menu on the right of the screen

  • Search for a contact and choose their relationship to the scheme from the drop-down menu.

    • To add a new contact, click the Contact field and then New

    • Enter the required details into the fields and click Save & Close

    • Click the Contact field and add the newly created contact

  • Click Save & Close

  • Click New Attachment

  • Enter the following details:

    • Attachment Name

    • Attachment URL

  • Click Save

2. Scheme Configuration Actions

  • Navigate to the Configuration tab

  • Click Required Spotlight Checks and select an option from the drop-down menu

  • Indicate if Subjective Scoring is Required

    • If 'Yes' is selected, the fields Subjective Scoring Template and Subjective Scoring Quality Review Risk Threshold will appear

    • This will feed through to all applications for the Scheme

  • Click Objective Scoring Quality Review Risk Threshold and input a number between 1-100

    • If Subjective Scoring Required has been marked as 'Yes'. input a number into the Subjective Scoring Quality Review Risk Threshold field

    • This determines if an application goes to peer/quality review

  • Indicate if there is an Application Import Limit for this Scheme

    • This will limit the number of applications that can be imported into the Scheme.

  • Add an Objective Scoring Template to the Scheme

    • See below for template set-up

    • If Subjective Scoring is Required, add a Subjective Scoring Template

2a. Setting Up a Scoring Template

  • Select the Objective Scoring Template field

  • Add a pre-existing checklist template or click New to set-up a new template

  • Enter a Name into the Name field

  • Click Save

  • Click New Scoring Template Section and enter the following:

    • Name

    • Order

  • Click Save

  • Repeat to add multiple Scoring Template Sections to the Scoring Template

  • Click New Scoring Template Question and enter the following:

    • Title

    • Description

    • Type

    • Order

    • Automation Enabled

      • Applicable Question

      • Automation Type

    o When adding Template Questions for the Subjective Scoring Checklist, ensure the field Weight is populated to be used in the calculation of the weighted average Subjective Score

  • Repeat to add multiple questions to the Scoring Template Section

  • Click Save

  • Return to the Configuration tab and select the created template under the Objective or Subjective Scoring Template field

  • Click Save

Note: Ensure a Scoring Template is assigned prior to importing applications into the Scheme. If no Template is provided, applications will not have a Scoring Checklist and must be deleted and re-imported into the Scheme.

3. Stage Actions Statuses

  • Navigate to the Stage Actions tab

  • Input the appropriate status of each of the listed actions from the drop-down menus

  • To progress to the Mobilisation stage, the fields should be completed as follows:

    • Onboarding Meeting: Scheduled/Completed

    • Scope of Work: In Draft/Awaiting Approval/Completed

    • MoU Document: Completed

    • HM Treasury Approval: Approved

    • Finance Business Partner Approval: Approved

    • Plan on a Page: Approved

  • Click Save

    • Advance Stage should become visible in the command bar

  • Click Advance Stage and then Refresh

The active stage should update to the Mobilisation stage of the Scheme set-up process.

1. Add Users as Administrators

  • Navigate to the Team tab*

  • Click the Add Existing User button in the Administrators section

    • A pop-up should appear on the right side of the screen

  • Search for the desired Grant Manager to the team

  • Click Add

  • Repeat these steps for Reviewers and Quality Controllers

*Further explanation of the Team tab in the section below

2. Stage Actions

  • Navigate to the Stage Actions tab and enter the following into each field:

    • GGIS (Government Grants Information System) - Completed

    • Email Inbox - Completed

    • Resources - Completed

    • Application Form - Completed

    • Competition Documents - Completed

    • Advert - Completed

  • Click Save

    • Once Save is clicked, Advance Stage should be visible in the command bar

  • Click Advance Stage

    • The scheme will update to the Awaiting Launch stage.

1. Team Tab Explained

  • Navigate to the Team tab

  • On the Administrators section, click Add Existing User

    • A pop-up on the right-hand side of the screen will appear

  • Click Look for records

  • Type the name of the user you want to add as an administrator into the look-up field

  • Select the user account and click Add at the bottom of the pop-up screen

    • This will add the user to the Administrators team

  • Repeat these steps to add team members to Reviewers and Quality Controllers

A flow runs daily to move the scheme to the Monitoring stage. Once the flow is triggered, applications will be pulled into GLU through Find & Apply.

  • Navigate to the Applications tab

  • Click the checkbox beside one of the applications

  • Click Delete Application

  • Click Sync Data and then Applications

  • Wait for 2 minutes and then refresh the record

    • The application should reappear from Find & Apply

Syncing Applications

  • Click Sync and then Applications in the command bar

  • Click Refresh

  • Navigate to the Applications tab

  • Applications will be visible in the All Applications table

When the closing date of applications is reached, the scheme will automatically move to the Assessment stage.

  • Select the GFA Template field

  • Click New in the pop-up menu or assign an existing template to the Scheme

  • Input a name for the template into the Title field

  • Input a Template Type

  • Click Save

  • Click Choose file beside the Question Ordering Field and upload a file as a CSV

  • Fill out all of the fields based on the sections populated by the department on the GFA template

  • Click Save & Close

  • Select the GFA Template field and add the newly created template

The Monitoring Template will be set up by a Scheme administrator.

  • Select the Monitoring Structure Template field

  • Click New or add a pre-existing template

  • Input a Name

  • Click Save

To generate a Payment File for an application, first ensure that you have extracted the bank details to populate the file. If this is not completed prior. the Payment File will be empty.

To generate the Payment File, follow these steps:

  • Click Generate Payment Filein the command bar

    • This will create a CSV file with the bank details that were previously extracted

  • Select the Documents tab

  • Observe the Documents section

    • The CSV file will be called Payment Details

  • The CSV file will now be ready to be sent to the department

Note: The CSV file won't be generated unless the Payment Status field on the Monitoring Activity has been updated to show Ready for Payment.

This sections shows how to update a scoring template for a scheme with applications that have already been synced in.

Updates here refer to adding a new section/question OR deleting an existing section/question

To update a Scoring Template,

1. Select to open the Objective or Subjective Template through the relevant field.

2. Complete the standard Scoring Template Sections and Questions as seen in the Premobilisation section of this guide.

3. Once done, Save & Close the Scoring Template.

4. Navigate to the Actions button, click on the Update Objective Checklist button to update the objective checklists AND/OR the Subjective Checklist button to update the subjective checklists

5. Wait for a few minutes

6. Open a checklist for an application under the Scheme to view the changes

All Applications View Help Page

This screen displays all of the applications currently linked to the active Schemes.

Amend View

To change your view (i.e. View Inactive Applications), click the View button here

Open Dashboards

To view which applications are assigned to you, click here

This section explains abbreviations that appear throughout GLU.

GFA = Grant Funding Agreement

GGIS = Government Grants Information System

GGMS = Government Grants Managed Service

PPON = Public Procurement Organisation Number

This section explains the purpose of the buttons in the ribbon at the top of the screen.

1. Search

The Search button in the ribbon enables the user to search for Account, Contact, and User records in GLU.

2. New

The New button in the ribbon enables the user to create a new record within GLU. It will open a pop-up menu where the user can input data to create the record.

3. Advanced Find

The Advanced Find button in the ribbon enables the user to search for rows in a table using advanced filters.

4. Settings

The Settings button in the ribbon enables the user to view the General, Personalisation and Advanced settings of GLU. It will open a pop-up menu for the user to view each section.

5. Help

The Help Button in the ribbon enables the user to view the Help Panes with embedded guidance for each screen within GLU. It opens a pop-up on the right of the screen.

Scoring Template Set-Up

To set up a Scoring Template, complete the following steps:

  • Input a Name into the Name field

  • Click Save

    • The Scoring Template Section will appear below the Name field

  • Click + New Scoring Template Section

Monitoring Structure Template Help Pane

To set up the initial Monitoring Structure Template:

  • Input a Name

  • Click Save

  • Click New Monitoring Activity Template to add an Activity Template to the Monitoring Structure

1. Enter the Query into the Query field

2. Enter the Applicant Name or create a new contact for a new applicant

3. Enter the Scheme via the Lookup Field

4. Click Save to created the record.

Once the record is Saved, the Generate AI Response button will become visible.

Generate AI Response

1. Select Generate AI Response to generate an AI Response to the query. The AI Response will be generated based on stored FAQ Documents for the given scheme.

2. Click Refresh after a few seconds to view AI suggested response

Send Response to Applicant

Reponses are shared offline but are documented in GLU.

1. Enter a date into the Response Sent On field.

2. Enter the response sent to the Applicant into the Response Sent field.

The Mark Complete button becomes visible once the Response Sent On field has been populated

The AI Suggested Answer can have three possible values:

1. Positive Path: A suggested answer will be displayed in the AI Suggested Answer field based on matching keywords or successful sentiment matching.

2. No Data Path: This is shown when a query has been entered and a scheme without existing FAQ Data has been selected as the related scheme on the query. AI models use the scheme to query the right FAQ data so if a scheme with no data is referenced, the phrase "Insufficient data for AI response - Ensure that the specified scheme on the Query Record has data in the FAQ Document." will be shown.

3. No Match Path: This is shown when no matching keywords or sentiment matching is lower than the confidence threshold. This means the AI model is not confident that an answer in the question bank for that scheme answers the query. The phrase "No strong match found. Manual review of FAQ Data is required" will be shown.

Monitoring Checklist Question Template Help Pane

To set up the Monitoring Checklist Question Template:

  • Input data into the following fields:

    • Name

    • Description

    • Order

  • Choose a Type from the drop-down menu

    • If Choice is picked, input options separated by a comma into the Choice Options field e.g. Yes, No. This field will only appear when Choice has been selected as the Type

  • Click Save to add the Question to the Section Template

  • Click the back arrow to navigate back to the Monitoring Section Template
msdyn_helppage.msdyn_displayname: Monitoring Checklist Question Template Help Pane

msdyn_helppage.msdyn_content:
Monitoring Checklist Section Help Pane

The administrator can make edits to the Monitoring Structure.

To add a Monitoring Checklist Section to the template:

  • Click + New Monitoring Checklist Section Template

  • Input data into the following:

    • Name

    • Order

  • Click Save

To remove a Monitoring Checklist Section from the template:

  • Click Delete in the command bar

To add a Monitoring Checklist Question:

  • Click + New Monitoring Checklist Question

Monitoring Activity Help Pane

For Scheme Administrators only

1. Confirm Monitoring Structure

Only the Scheme Administrator is able to make edits to the Monitoring Structure, Once the Admin has made the necessary changes, such as adding a new Checklist Question:

  • Click Actions

  • Select Confirm Monitoring

Once the Monitoring Structure has been confirmed by the Administrator, it will be reassigned to a Reviewer on the Scheme.

1. Document Upload

  • Click + New Document in the Submission Documents section

  • Upload a document from your computer

  • Click Save & Close

2. Initial Review

  • Click Actions and then Monitoring Checklist Pop-Up

  • Open a Section and then a Question

  • Input an answer into each question

    • Use the arrows to navigate between questions

  • Click the X in the top right of the Checklist

  • Navigate to the Assessment tab

  • Click Initial Review Outcome and enter an answer from the drop-down menu

  • Select the Spotlight Checks Complete field and enter an answer from the drop-down menu

  • Click Save

  • Click Actions and then Submit Initial Outcome

  • Click Refresh

3. Peer Review

  • Click Actions and then Monitoring Checklist Pop-Up

  • Open a Section and then a Question

  • Input an answer into each question

    • Use the arrows to navigate between questions

  • Click the X in the top right of the Checklist

  • Navigate to the Assessment tab

  • Click Peer Review Outcome and enter an answer from the drop-down menu

  • Click Save

  • Click Actions and then Submit Peer Outcome

  • Click Refresh

4. Quality Review

If Quality Review is required for the Monitoring Process:

  • Click Actions and then Monitoring Checklist Pop-Up

  • Open a Section and then a Question

  • Input an answer into each question

    • Use the arrows to navigate between questions

  • Click the X in the top right of the Checklist

  • Navigate to the Assessment tab

  • Click Final Review Outcome and enter an answer from the drop-down menu

  • Click Save

  • Click Actions and then Submit Final Outcome

  • Click Refresh

5. Payment Confirmation

  • Click the Payment Status field

  • Enter an answer from the drop-down menu

    • Mark the Payment Status as Ready for Payment or Not Suitable for Payment

To complete the Payment Confirmation stage of the Monitoring Activity, the payment file needs to be generated. Once this is completed, the Payment Status field will be updated to Payment Requested and the Payment Amount field will be locked.

Monitoring Checklist Help Pane

The administrator can make changes to the Monitoring Structure.

To add a new Monitoring Checklist Section:

  • Click + New Monitoring Checklist Section

Feedback Submittals Help Pane

This page allows you to offer feedback regarding GLU and its capabilities.

Instructions

To provide feedback, populate the following fields:

  • Were you able to do what you needed today?

  • Describe the ease of use

  • Why did you give this score?

  • Overall opinion of our service?

When you have finished detailing your feedback, please click Save & Close.

Once a day, all pieces of feedback will be submitted to the GLU Product Team, alongside the name of the user who provided the feedback, who will review all feedback.

Queries are created manually in GLU.

1. Select New to create a New Query.

Scoring Template Set-Up

To set up a Scoring Template Section, complete the following steps:

  • Input a Name for the Scoring Template Section

  • Input a number in the Order field

    • This will determine the order that the Sections appear on the Scoring Template

  • Click Save

    • The Scoring Template Question section will appear

  • Click+ New Scoring Template Question

  • Click the back arrow to navigate to the Scoring Template

  • Repeat the above steps to add more Sections to the Scoring Template

Response Mappings Help Pane

Defining conditional logic and rules allows the Scoring process to be automated for simple questions and can drive efficiencies.

Set Up

To define the rules:

  • Add a new record for each rule for the associated Applicable Question (defined on the related Scoring Template Question)

  • Provide the expected answer from the applicant in the field Response (As Entered in Apply got a Grant)

  • Enter this exactly as it appears in the Find Application Form

  • Enter the answer that should appear in the field Answer (As Should be Entered in the Scoring Checklist)

  • Click Save & Close

Monitoring Activity Template Help Pane

To set up the Monitoring Activity Template:

  • Populate the following fields:

    • Name

    • Order

    • Description

    • Earliest Possible Submission Date

    • Latest Possible Submission Date

    • Expected Payment Date

  • Click Save

  • Select the back arrow to go back to the Monitoring Structure Template

    • Repeat the above to add more Monitoring Activity Templates to the Monitoring Structure

  • Select Monitoring Checklist Template to begin creating a Checklist for this activity

    • Select New or choose a pre-existing template

1. Enter a Name in the FAQ Document Name field.

2. Click Save to create record.

3. Once Saved, select to upload a file against the FAQ Document field.

Ensure the document is in the following format:

1. CSV UTF-8 format. Ensure it is in UTF-8 format to avoid encoding issues with special characters.

2. Has the following columns only; Question, Answer and Tags.

Before uploading the FAQ Document CSV file, the file must have the following columns;

1. Question

2. Answer

3. Tags

Tags

Tags are used to categorise the question on the FAQ Document.

For example, the question "When is the deadline for submitting applications on the UKSA scheme" can be classified as Application.

GLU has been tested with the following tags:

1. Application

2. Eligibility

3. Funding

4. Documents

Only Admins on a Scheme can delete FAQ Data entries.

Viewing a row in the FAQ Table

Admins have access to a tab called Manage FAQ Document. This views allow Admins to view the FAQ data in more detail;

1. Question

2. Answer

3. Tags

Deleting the row

When viewing a document upload in this view - Admins should be able to see and select a Delete button in the command bar at the top to delete the FAQ entry/row.

Uploading a Document Help Page

To upload a document, complete the following steps:

  • Input a File Name into the field

  • Click Save

    • A button beside the Upload Document field should appear

  • Click Choose file and select a document to upload

  • Navigate back to the previous tab to add the document to the application

GFA Template Set-Up Help Pane

  • Input a name for the template into the Title field

  • Input a Template Type from the drop-down menu

  • Click Save

  • Click Choose file beside the Question Ordering Field and upload a file as a CSV

  • Fill out all of the Basic Information fields based on the sections populated by the department on the GFA template

  • Enter an Eligibility Statement in the field

  • Click Save & Close

  • On the Configuration tab, select the GFA Template field and add the newly created template to the Scheme

Monitoring Checklist Section Template Help Pane

To set up a Monitoring Checklist Section Template:

  • Input a Name into the field

  • Input an Order

  • Click Save

  • Click New Monitoring Checklist Question Template
msdyn_helppage.msdyn_displayname: Monitoring Checklist Section Template Help Pane

msdyn_helppage.msdyn_content:
Scoring Template Set-Up

To set up a Scoring Template Question, complete the following steps:

  • Input data into the following fields:

    • Title

    • Description

    • Order

  • Choose a Type from the drop-down menu

    • If selecting Boolean or Choice, the Choice Options section will appear

    • Input data separated by a comma to determine the answer to be selected e.g. Yes, No

  • Click Save

  • Click the back arrow to navigate to the Scoring Template Section

  • Repeat the above steps to add more Questions to the Scoring Template Section

Adding a New Attachment Help Page

To add a new attachment to the Scheme, enter data into the following fields:

  • Attachment Name

  • Attachment URL

  • Click Save & Close
msdyn_helppage.msdyn_displayname: Adding a New Attachment Help Page

msdyn_helppage.msdyn_content:
All Schemes View Help Page

This screen displays all the Active Schemes you have been added to.

Missing Schemes

If a scheme is missing is missing from this view, contact the Scheme Admin to add you to the Scheme team as an Admin, Reviewer or Quality Controller. Once you have been added, the scheme should be visible in this section

Amend View

To change your view (i.e. View Inactive Schemes), click the view button here

View PowerBI Report

To view the PowerBI Report displaying information on Schemes and Applications across all the key stages, click Launch PowerBI Report

Create a New Scheme

To create a New Scheme, select New.

Delete an Existing Scheme

To delete an existing scheme, select Delete

This section explains abbreviations that appear throughout GLU.

GFA = Grant Funding Agreement

GGIS = Government Grants Information System

GGMS = Government Grants Managed Service

PPON = Public Procurement Organisation Number

Application Form Help Page

1. Document Upload

  • Navigate to the Documents tab and click New Document

  • Enter the following into the New Document record:

    • File Name

  • Click Save

    • The Upload Document field should now be visible

1. Objective Scoring

  • Navigate to the Assessment tab

  • Click Actions and then Open Objective Scoring in the command bar

    • A Scoring Checklist should pop-up

  • Open a Scoring Checklist Section and then a Question

  • Enter an answer to the Question

    • Use the arrows in the bottom right of the screen to navigate between Checklist Questions

  • Select Add Comments to input any comments and click Save

    • When a comment is added to a checklist question, an asterisk (*) will appear to notify the user

  • Click the X in the top right to close the Checklist

  • Click the Refresh button

  • Click the Verify Checklist Completion button in the command bar to verify that all the checklist questions have been completed. If an error message is shown, open the checklist and ensure all the answer fields have been populated.

  • Navigate to the Assessment tab and input an answer from the drop-down menu into the Initial Objective Outcome field

  • Click Save in the command bar

  • Click Actions and then Submit (Initial) Objective Scoring

  • Click Refresh

Note: The Submit (Initial) Objective Outcome button only becomes visible when ALL the scoring checklist questions have been answered.

1.1 Vehicle Registration Details

Note: This section will only appear on the application record if a vehicle registration number (VRN) has been provided on an application form for a vehicle-related scheme by the applicant

  • Navigate to the Assessment tab on the application

  • Scroll to the Vehicle Registration section

  • Confirm that the following fields have been populated:

    • VRN

    • Verification Response

    • Fuel Type

    • Make

    • Model

    • Type Approval

  • Select an option from the drop-down menu in the VRN Verification Outcome field

  • Click Save

2. Due Diligence Actions

Note: Due Diligence can be completed at any point until the Department Confirmation stage of the application Assessment process

2A. Upload Spotlight Output

  • Navigate to the Summary tab

  • Open the shared Spotlight Standard output file and copy the Application Number on the CSV file into the GAP ID field

  • Select the link to the scheme under the field 'Scheme'

  • Click Integration Files and select New Integration File

  • Enter details into the following fields:

    • File Name

    • Integration Type

  • Click Save

2B. Import Flags

  • Upload Spotlight output in the standard format

  • Select the checkbox beside the uploaded file

  • Click the Import Flags button

  • Click Refresh

  • Navigate to the Applications tab and select an Application

  • View the Assessment tab

  • View and assess the identified flags in the manner appropriate for the Scheme

4. Quality Control

Note: Quality Control might not be required for the application. If this is the case, ignore the below steps as the application will automatically move to the correct step.

  • The application will be reassigned to a member of the Quality Control team on the Scheme

  • Click Actions and then Open Objective Scoring

    • The Scoring Checklist popup will appear

  • Review the answers provided by the Initial Reviewer and populate the answers as you see fit

  • Close the popup using the X button

  • Click Refresh

  • Click the Verify Checklist Completion button in the command bar to verify that all the checklist questions have been completed. If an error message is shown, open the checklist and ensure all the answer fields have been populated.

  • Navigate to the Assessment tab and input a response into Final Objective Outcome

  • Click Save

  • Click Actions and then Submit (Final) Objective Scoring in the command bar

  • Click Refresh

Note: The Submit (Final) Objective Outcome button only becomes visible when ALL the scoring checklist questions have been answered.

Reassign Application

  • Click Reassign Application in the command bar

  • Select a reviewer via the Reassign a Review pop-up

  • Click Confirm and Refresh

1. Subjective Scoring

  • (Navigate to the All Applications tab on the scheme and open an application

  • Navigate to the Assessment tab

  • Click Actions and then Open Subjective Scoring in the command bar

    • A Scoring Checklist should pop-up

  • Open a Scoring Checklist Section and then a Question

  • Enter answers into each Question

    • Use the arrows in the bottom right of the screen to navigate between Checklist Questions

  • When you have finished scoring, use the back buttons beside the Checklist title to return to the initial checklist

  • Click the Calculate Weighted Average button to calculate the score

  • Click the X in the top right to close the Checklist.

  • Click Refresh

  • Click the Verify Checklist Completion button in the command bar to verify that all the checklist questions have been completed. If an error message is shown, open the checklist and ensure all the answer fields have been populated.

  • Validate the field Initial Subjective Scoring has been populated

  • Click Save

  • Click Actions and then Submit (Initial) Subjective Scoring

  • Click Refresh

Note: The Submit (Initial) Subjective Outcome button only becomes visible when ALL the scoring checklist questions have been answered.

2. Peer Review

  • The application will be reassigned to another member of the Reviewers team on the Scheme to complete the Peer Review

  • When completing a Peer Review, follow step 1. Subjective Scoring within this section

  • To submit the score:

    • Refresh the page

    • Click on the Verify Checklist Completion button to validate the checklist

    • Validate the field Peer Subjective Scoring has been populated

    • Click Save

    • Click Actions and then Submit (Peer) Subjective Scoring

    • Click Refresh

Note: The Submit (Peer) Subjective Outcome button only becomes visible when ALL the scoring checklist questions have been answered.

4. Quality Control

Note: Quality Control might not be required for the application. If this is the case, ignore the below steps as the application will automatically move to the correct step.

  • The application will be reassigned to a member of the Quality Control team on the Scheme

  • Click Actions and then Open Subjective Scoring

  • The Scoring Checklist popup will appear

  • Review the answers provided by the Initial Reviewer and Peer Reviewer and populate the answers as you see fit

  • Click the Calculate Weighted Average button to calculate the score

  • Close the popup using the X button

  • Click Refresh on the command bar

  • Click on the Verify Checklist Completion button to validate the checklist

  • Navigate to the Assessment tab and validate the field Final Subjective Scoring has been populated

  • Click Save

  • Click Actions and then Submit (Final) Subjective Scoring in the command bar

  • Click Refresh

Note: The Submit (Final) Subjective Outcome button only becomes visible when ALL the scoring checklist questions have been answered.

*This action will appear after the Initial Objective Outcome has been submitted

This will restart the scoring process at any stage until Department Confirmation.

  • Select Actions in the command bar

  • Click Amend Scoring

Scoring will be pushed back to Objective Scoring and the application will be assigned back to the initial reviewer.

The Application will have been reassigned to a member of the Administrators team to complete this step.

1. GGMS (Government Grants Managed Service) Recommendation

  • Input the Amount Recommended

  • Click Save

  • Click Actions and then Submit GGMS Recommendation

  • Click Refresh

2. Department Confirmation

  • Input a response into the following fields:

    • Department Decision

    • Amount Allocated

  • Click Save

  • Click Actions and then Submit Department Decision

  • Click Refresh

1. Outcome Letter Generation

  • Navigate to the Outcome tab

  • Select the Notification Letter field

  • Select a pre-uploaded template or click New

    • Input a File Name and click Save

    • Click Choose File and upload a document

    • Navigate back to the Outcome tab

  • Click Save

  • Select Actions and then Submit Outcome Letter

  • Click Refresh

2. Outcome Letter Quality Review

If the Outcome Letter is subject to Quality Review:

  • Select Actions and then Confirm Outcome Letter

3. Outcome Letter Distribution & Confirmation

When the Outcome Letter has been distributed:

  • Select Actions and then Confirm Distribution

  • Click Notification Letter Applicant Response and select an option from the drop-down menu

  • Click Save

  • Click Actions and then Confirm Response

  • Click Refresh

1. GFA (Grant Funding Agreement) Generation

To generate a GFA Template for the application:

  • Select the Generate Standard GFA or Generate DIIF GFA button in the command bar

  • Click Generate on the pop-up

    • This will generate the GFA template for the application

  • When the template has generated, navigate to the Documents tab

  • In the Documents section, click on the newly generated GFA template

  • Download the GFA template to your computer

    • Make any necessary changes to the template

To continue with the Award process:

  • Navigate to the Award tab

  • Click the field GFA (Unsigned)

  • Upload a GFA template to the field

  • Click GFA Initial Review Completed On and input a date

  • Click Save

  • Click Actions and then Confirm Initial GFA Review

  • Click Refresh

2. GFA (Unsigned) Quality Review

  • Click the GFA Quality Review Completed Onfield and input a date

  • Click Save

  • Click Actions and then Confirm GFA (Unsigned) Quality Review

3. GFA Signing

  • Click the GFA Sent On field and input a date

  • Click Save

  • Click Actions and then Confirm GFA (Unsigned) Sent

  • Click the GFA Signed & Received On fieldand input a date

  • Click Save

  • Click Actions and then Confirm GFA Received

4. GFA Completeness Review

  • Click the GFA Completeness Review Completed On field and input a date

  • Click Save

  • Click Actions and then Confirm GFA Completeness Review

5. Signed GFA Email Review

  • Click the Signed GFA Email Review Completed On field and input a date

  • Click Save

  • Click Actions and then Confirm GFA Email Review

6. Signed GFA Email Quality Review

  • Click theSigned GFA Email Quality Review field and input a date

  • Click Save

  • Click Actions and then Confirm GFA Email Quality Review

7. GFA Distribution

  • Click the Final GFA field and upload the final document

    • This document should include Banking Details for the application

    • A document must be assigned with the required Banking Details to be able to generate the Payment File

  • Click Save

  • Click Actions and then Confirm GFA

  • Click Actions and then Confirm GFA Distribution in the command bar

  • Click Refresh

The Current Stage of the application will update to Monitoring Draft and the Monitoring Structure field will unlock.

To extract bank details to populate the Payment File, follow these steps:

  • If the banking details are included in the GFA template, skip to the Award tab

  • Click on the Documents tab

  • Select New Document

  • Input a Name into the Name field

    • To ensure the bank details will be extracted, name the document Final GFA

  • Click Save

  • Click Choose file and upload the required banking form

  • Click the Award tab

  • Select theFinal GFA field and upload the Final GFA document

  • Click Save

  • Click Extract Bank Details in the command bar

  • Click Extract on the pop-up

    • The extraction process will begin

1. Monitoring Structure Confirmation (Administrator only)

Once the application enters the Monitoring Draft stage, it will be assigned to an Administrator on the Scheme. The Administrator is the only one who can make changes to the Monitoring Structure Template.

  • Click on the Monitoring Structure field to open the template

  • Make the necessary changes:

    • Guidance to complete these changes will appear on the relevant help pane

Once the Administrator has made the necessary changes:

  • Click Actions and then Confirm Monitoring

    • This will lock the template so no further edits can be made, and the application will be assigned to a Reviewer on the Scheme

2. Monitoring Process - Document Upload

  • Navigate to the Award tab

  • Click Monitoring Structure and then open a Monitoring Activity

  • Click + New Document in Submission Documents

  • Upload a document from your computer

  • Click Save & Close

3. Monitoring Process - Initial Review

  • Click Actions and then Monitoring Checklist Pop-Up

  • Open a Section and then a Question

  • Input an answer into each Question

  • Click the X in the top right of the Checklist

  • Navigate to the Assessment tab on the Monitoring Activity

  • Click Initial Review Outcome and enter an answer from the drop-down menu

  • Select the Spotlight Checks Complete field and enter an answer

  • Click Save

  • Click Actions and then Submit Initial Outcome

  • Click Refresh

4. Monitoring Process - Peer Review

  • Click Actions and then Monitoring Checklist Pop-Up

  • Open a Section and then a Question

  • Input an answer into each question

  • Click the X in the top right of the Checklist

  • Navigate to the Assessment tab on the Monitoring Activity Summary

  • Click Peer Review Outcome and enter an answer from the drop-down menu

  • Click Save

  • Click Actions and then Submit Peer Outcome

  • Click Refresh

5. Monitoring Process - Quality Review

If Quality Review is required for the Monitoring Process:

  • Click Actions and then Monitoring Checklist Pop-Up

  • Open a Section and then a Question

  • Input an answer into each question

  • Click the X in the top right of the Checklist

  • Navigate to the Assessment tab on the Monitoring Activity Summary

  • Click Final Review Outcome and enter an answer from the drop-down menu

  • Click Save

  • Click Actions and then Submit Final Outcome

  • Click Refresh

6. Monitoring Process - Payment Confirmation

  • Click the Payment Status field

  • Enter an answer from the drop-down menu

    • Select either Ready for Payment or Not Suitable for Payment

  • Once the Payment File has been generated, the Payment Status field will update to Payment Requested and the Amount field will lock

To generate the Payment File, first ensure that the bank details have been extracted to populate the file. Otherwise, the Payment File will be empty.

  • On the Scheme record, click Generate Payment File in the command bar

    • This will create a CSV file with the bank details that were previously extracted

  • Navigate to the Document tab on the Scheme and observe the uploaded CSV file - called Payment Details

  • On the Monitoring Activity Assessment tab, the payment status will be set to Payment Requested

  • The CSV will then be ready to send to the department

Note: The CSV file will not be generated unless the Payment Status field on the Monitoring Activity has been updated to show Ready for Payment.

Subjective Scoring Template Set-Up

  • Select the Name field and input a Name for the Scoring Template

  • Click Save

    • The Scoring Template Section will appear below the Name field

  • Click + New Scoring Template Section

Monitoring Checklist Template Help Pane

To set up the

  • Input a Name into the field

  • Click Save

  • Select New Monitoring Checklist Section Template to create a Checklist Section for the template

Report Issues Help Pane

This page allows you to report any issues you encounter while using GLU.

Instruction

Enter the details of the issue you encountered in the field Please detail the issue you encountered

Include all detail you think is relevant, and all detail that will assist the Product Team in resolving the issue.

If the issue is specific to a Scheme, please search for the name of the Scheme in the field If applicable, select the related scheme

When you have finished detailing your issue, please click Save & Close.

The issue will then be submitted to the GLU Product Team, alongside the name and email of the user who submitted the issue, and the Product Team will review the details.
